intro: Solanum colombianum var. zipaquiranum, commonly known as the Zipaquirá tomato, is a wild tomato species native to the Andes region of Colombia. It is characterized by its small, oval-shaped fruits that typically range in color from red to yellow when mature. The plant is an herbaceous shrub with hairy stems and alternate, ovate leaves with serrated edges. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soils. This variety is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its potential for genetic diversity and adaptation to specific ecological conditions.
